page.title: 17THE HARBOUR MASTER'S OFFICE
page.content: THE HARBOUR MASTER'S OFFICE CONTROLS SHIPS AND SAFETY OF NAVIGATION IN THE HARBOUR AND UP TO 5 MILES OUT TO SEA. THEY DO MAINTENANCE DREDGING EVERY YEAR AND CAPITAL DREDGING EVERY 5 YEARS USING A BUCKET TYPE DREDGER. BEFORE THE CHANNEL WAS DREDGED IT WAS 8.9 METRES DEEP; AFTER CURRENT DREDGING IT WILL BE 11 METRES. THERE ARE 24,000 SHIPPING MOVEMENTS EVERY YEAR. SHIPS COMING INTO THE HARBOUR PAY AN AVERAGE OF 5p PER TON. THEY GET CALLS FROM MANY DIFFERENT SHIPS ASKING ABOUT WHERE THEY SHOULD BERTH AND AT WHAT TIME ETC. THEY HAVE THREE RADARS, 7 RADIOS, 2 GAUGES AND 2 ANNENOMETERS. THEY ALSO ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR NAVIGATION BUOYS, SURVEYING HOW MUCH WATER THERE IS AND ALSO OIL POLLUTION. THEY ALSO HAVE TO ENSURE THAT ALL OF THE HARBOUR REGULATIONS ARE OBEYED.
